e="preserve">Marvin Zonis (September 18, 1936 – November 15, 2020) was an American political economist. His works focused on Middle East<nowiki/>ern politics and history. He was an emeritus professor at the University of Chicago Booth School of Business. He was the first professor at the Business School to teach a course on digital technologies.
Zonis died on November 15, 2020 in Chicago at the age of 84.
